name: Discovery Quality Rubric
description: Evaluates quality of discovery questions, active listening, and MEDDIC/BANT coverage

scoring_guide.90-100: Exceptional discovery - thorough MEDDIC coverage, insightful follow-up questions, active listening demonstrated
scoring_guide.80-89: Strong discovery - good coverage of most MEDDIC elements, some missed opportunities for deeper probing
scoring_guide.70-79: Adequate discovery - basic qualification achieved, but lacks depth or misses key elements
scoring_guide.60-69: Weak discovery - superficial questions, poor listening, minimal qualification
scoring_guide.0-59: Poor discovery - primarily presenting without understanding customer needs

question_quality.description: Quality and depth of questions asked

excellent: Open-ended questions that uncover business impact
Follow-up questions that dig deeper into responses
Questions reveal priorities and decision criteria
Probing questions to understand pain points thoroughly
poor: Questions focused on product features vs. business needs
Asking questions already answered in prep materials

active_listening.description: Demonstrates listening and building on customer responses

excellent: References specific customer statements in responses
Paraphrases customer concerns to confirm understanding
Connects current topic to earlier customer statements
poor: Provides generic responses not tailored to customer input
Doesn't acknowledge or build on customer concerns

elements.metrics: Quantifies business impact (time saved, cost reduction, efficiency gains)
elements.economic_buyer: Identifies budget holder and decision-making authority
elements.decision_criteria: Uncovers technical and business requirements for solution selection
elements.decision_process: Understands timeline, stakeholders, and approval steps
elements.identify_pain: Explores current challenges and consequences of inaction
elements.champion: Identifies internal advocate who will sell on your behalf

talk_listen_ratio.description: Balance of talking vs. listening during discovery

strong_discovery.quote: You mentioned your data engineers spend 40% of their time debugging Airflow DAGs. Can you walk me through a recent example? What was the root cause, and how long did resolution take?
strong_discovery.analysis: Open-ended question that quantifies pain, asks for specific example, and probes for impact. Demonstrates active listening by referencing customer's earlier statement.

weak_discovery.quote: So you're looking for a workflow orchestration tool?
weak_discovery.analysis: Closed question that doesn't uncover needs. Assumes intent without exploring current challenges or desired outcomes.
